;;< p data-component="paragraph" class="css-1f0x4sl e1tt35bk0">;;印度股市;今年早些时候成为全球第四大股市，在意外的选举结果出现后剧烈波动纳伦德拉·莫迪领导的印度人民党失去多数席位。出口民调预测印度人民党将取得压倒性胜利后，基准 BSE Sensex 指数在结果公布后下跌 6%，创下历史新高。第二天就恢复了一些。莫迪先生的亲密伙伴高塔姆·阿达尼 (Gautam Adani) 所拥有的公司的股价受到的打击尤其严重。

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/06/06/business /内容/aj43f4upu7824op2h9o17lch9guj7gq5 Thu, 06 Jun 2024 12:54:44 GMT 政治
;;;;
;;
;;

;;;纳伦德拉·莫迪;;在他的印度人民党及其盟友赢得微弱多数后，看起来可能会第三次担任印度总理。执政联盟赢得了 293 个席位，而反对党则赢得了 234 个席位。莫迪曾声称他们将赢得超过 400 个席位。与 2019 年上次选举相比，;印度人民党;本身失去了 63 个席位。

;

;前总理伊姆兰·汗 (Imran Khan) ;巴基斯坦;的一名男子在伊斯兰堡高等法院的一项裁决中被判无泄露国家机密罪。这位前板球运动员将因另一项定罪而继续入狱。他正在对此案提出上诉。

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/06/06/politics /内容/5u7ue825r5kles8bfpv6285prsh16eup Thu, 06 Jun 2024 12:54:42 GMT 本周封面

;;T;;HIS WEEK WE; 有两个封面。在英国，我们考虑了工党执政后可能采取的行动。关于经济增长，即工党政府计划的核心内容，答案是：还不够。

;
;;;
;;
;;

;;T;;他的一周我们;有两个封面。在英国，我们考虑了工党执政后可能采取的行动。关于经济增长，即工党政府计划的核心内容，答案是：还不够。

;
;;;
;; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/06/06/this-weeks-covers /内容/3da568s97u4ndstuvvehub3h5aoomr1b Thu, 06 Jun 2024 10:30:35 GMT 政治
;;;;
;; ; ; ; ; ;

; 225 亿美元，使其成为美国最新的能源大型合并。石油和天然气公司正在进行整合，以削减成本并扩大规模。马拉松在德克萨斯州的Eagle Ford拥有资产，北达科他州的Bakken，新墨西哥州和德克萨斯州的二叠纪以及俄克拉荷马州的资产。

;

; HESS ;是一家能源探索公司，批准了雪佛兰;的有争议的530亿美元收购。赫斯持有圭亚那沿海一个大型油田项目30%的股份。雪佛龙公司的提议受到埃克森美孚（Exxonmobil）的质疑，埃克森美孚公司（Exxonmobil）拥有圭亚那项目（Guyana Project）45％的股份，并声称它有权与赫斯（Hess）就资产进行谈判。埃克森美孚已启动仲裁程序。 ; ISS，;一家代理奖励公司，建议在进行仲裁期间拒绝股东放弃投票。

;

; ;本周卡通的主题：
; ; ;如何保存南非
; ; ;为什么这是南非自1994年以来最重要的选举
; ;来自档案：; nkosi sikelel'i afrika-他们将需要它;（1994）

; https://www.economist.com/the-world-thisweek/2024/05/30/kals-cartoon /content/516f2tsh69d8rekvjdqeh2c49gg887ce Thu, 30 May 2024 13:11:36 GMT 本周的封面

; commion =“ css zqomh4”>;。css-zqomh4 {color：var（ - ds-color-london-5）; font-family：var（-ds-ds-type-systystem-serif-linining）; font-size; font-size; font-size： var（-ds-type-scale-2）; font-权重：500; line-height：var（-ds-type-leading-upper）; margin-bottom：0.25REM;} ;

;从6月1日2024年6月1日版本

; ;

;从本节中发现故事，以及更多内容列表

; ;探索版本; ;
; ;

;;I;;n America and; Asia this week we feature the grassroots movement that could yet decide November's presidential election. Elsewhere we look at the epic choices facing three women with the future of Europe in their hands.

;

;A third of American women aged 15-49 now live in states where abortion is either illegal or impossibly restricted. Some states have passed statutes so severe and vaguely drafted that doctors fear they may be forced to choose between saving a patient's life and breaking the law. Yet gloomy as this reversal seems, it has also given rise to America's most dynamic new political movement: a revolt of millions of Americans who think that the government has little business inserting itself into private decisions.

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/30/this-weeks-covers /content/52tdhua9on13k460jg21de1jmbp4mu93 Thu, 30 May 2024 12:12:23 GMT KAL的卡通
;;;
;;
;;

;;Dig deeper into the subject of this week's cartoon:
;;;Rishi Sunak's election call makes no sense, but is good news
;;;The Economist's prediction for the next Parliament
;;;The Conservatives' world has disappeared. Don't tell Rishi Sunak;

;

;;KAL's cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week's ;here;.;

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/23/kals-cartoon /content/46c913ffbff4jdf1hlbqq61uufsmjiqi Thu, 23 May 2024 13:26:48 GMT 商业
;;;< /figure>;
;;
;;

;The demand for chips to power artificial-intelligence services from the likes of Meta and Microsoft helped boost ;;Nvidia;'s; revenues to $26bn in the latest quarter, a 262% increase, year on年。净利润飙升 628% 至 149 亿美元。该公司承诺还会推出更多产品。 It will soon start to ship its new Blackwell chips, which cost more than $30,000 each.

;;

;Non-performance pay

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/23/business /content/c6p8scgvdaglhbt9ga8n158tno4trlqn Thu, 23 May 2024 13:26:45 GMT 政治
;;;
;;
;;

;;
;Iran's; president, ;Ebrahim Raisi;, and its foreign minister, Hossein Amirabdollahian, were killed in a helicopter crash. The country's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, named a caretaker president ahead of elections on June 28th.莱西是接替哈梅内伊担任最高领袖的主要竞争者。 His death makes it more likely that Mr Khamenei's son, Mojtaba, will replace his father.

;

;The ;;International Criminal Court;'s; prosecutor announced that he was seeking arrest warrants for the Israeli prime minister, Binyamin Netanyahu, and defence minister, Yoav Gallant, as well as three leaders of Hamas. Joe Biden, the American president, called the Israeli warrants “outrageous”; his government may work with Congress to impose sanctions on the; ICC.; Mr Netanyahu's opponents, who have threatened to leave his government if he does not change course in Gaza, rallied round him too.

;< /div>; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/23/politics /content/g23p3mtua8kdp233lppg6fbv2vj3bih4 Thu, 23 May 2024 13:26:41 GMT This week's covers

;;W;;E have; two covers this week. In most of the world we consider why baby-boosting policies won't work. As birth rates plunge in rich countries, many politicians are keen to pour money into policies that might lead women to have more children. Yet all these attempts are likely to fail, because they are built on a misapprehension. The bulk of the decline in the fertility rate in such countries is among younger, poorer women who are delaying when they start to have children, and who therefore have fewer overall. Focusing on these women as a group would be bad for them and for society. Teenage pregnancies are linked to poverty and ill health for both mother and child. Targeted incentives would roll back decades of efforts to curb unwanted teenage pregnancy and encourage women into study and work. Most economies will therefore have to adapt to social change, and it falls to governments to smooth the way.

;
;;;
;;
;;

;;W;;E have; two covers this week. In most of the world we consider why baby-boosting policies won't work. As birth rates plunge in rich countries, many politicians are keen to pour money into policies that might lead women to have more children. Yet all these attempts are likely to fail, because they are built on a misapprehension. The bulk of the decline in the fertility rate in such countries is among younger, poorer women who are delaying when they start to have children, and who therefore have fewer overall. Focusing on these women as a group would be bad for them and for society. Teenage pregnancies are linked to poverty and ill health for both mother and child. Targeted incentives would roll back decades of efforts to curb unwanted teenage pregnancy and encourage women into study and work. Most economies will therefore have to adapt to social change, and it falls to governments to smooth the way.

;
;;;
;

;惊喜;俄罗斯;安全机构的改组，弗拉基米尔·普京将;谢尔盖·绍伊古 (Sergei Shoigu) 自 2012 年起担任国防部长，调任国家安全委员会委员。 His replacement is Andrei Belousov, an economist with no experience of security matters but who has worked extensively on military budgets. The changing of the guard will have little effect on operations in Ukraine. Mr Putin prefers to speak directly to Valery Gerasimov, his senior general in the field.别洛乌索夫先生表示，他的任务是取得胜利，但“人员损失最小”，大概只是俄罗斯方面。

;

;普京先生会见了他的中国同行，;;习近平;;，在北京。 It was his first trip abroad since winning a sham election in March. The leaders reaffirmed their support for each other.西方官员指责习近平支持普京在乌克兰的战争机器。

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/16/politics /内容/gid4ipv2gmmkeoap4c6471tm50546oqh Thu, 16 May 2024 13:32:44 GMT 商业
;;;;
;;
;;

;Joe Biden imposed another round of tariffs on Chinese exports to America, most notably increasing the duties on ;;电动汽车;; 至 100%。美国进口的中国电动汽车相对较少，但拜登表示他的举措是先发制人的。中国汽车制造商正在欧洲扩张，但“我们不会让中国淹没我们的市场”，总统说道，他的目光聚焦于密歇根州的选票，密歇根州是美国汽车工业的中心，也是 11 月大选的关键州。 Tariffs are also going up on semiconductors, solar cells and critical minerals.愤怒的中国将这一决定描述为“政治操纵”，并发誓要进行报复。

;

;;英美资源集团;决定打破加强其业务，以抵御 ;;必和必拓;（; ;;）修改后的收购要约，收购价为 340 亿英镑（430 亿美元）。 Anglo will divest its coking coal assets and spin off its platinum and De Beers diamonds divisions. It is also considering the options for its nickel business in order to focus on copper, iron ore and crop nutrients.这家矿业巨头的总部位于伦敦，但在南非拥有 45,000 名员工，该公司于 1917 年在南非成立；那里的政府希望在任何分拆或出售过程中拥有发言权。

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/16/business /内容/t2aep72pivkdci7ov71fjr912dn36jtf Thu, 16 May 2024 13:32:44 GMT 本周封面
;;;
;;
;;;自 2024 年 5 月 18 日版起;;

;Discover stories from this section and more在内容列表中

;;;探索版本;;
;;
;;

;;我;<小>;如果您来自见证了共产主义崩溃和西方民主胜利的一代人，可能很难理解我们如何提出本周封面上的问题。然而美国人却听到他们自己的领导人谴责他们民主的完整性。 They have seen fellow citizens try to block the transfer of power from one administration to the next.在过去的四分之一个世纪里，不负责任的战争、金融危机和制度腐烂已经释放出美国政治的残暴，这使得总统竞选似乎事关生死存亡。

;

;“独裁者”一词让人想起 20 世纪最恶劣的暴君。我们可以利用这种关联，戴上大元帅的鸭舌帽和“<小>;美国;”徽章，或者在林肯纪念堂台阶上举行纽伦堡集会。

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/16/this-weeks-cover /内容/4u2emkgrbcsin3lf97jfghiou4qk04gd Thu, 16 May 2024 13:13:12 GMT美国 政治
;;;;
;;
;;

;For the first time in five years, ;;Xi Jinping; visited Europe;. China's leader was welcomed by his French counterpart, Emmanuel Macron, who pressed him to help end the war in Ukraine and to establish a more balanced trade relationship.习近平没有做出任何让步。 He then moved on to Serbia, where he commemorated the 25th anniversary of America's bombing of the Chinese embassy in Belgrade. “我们永远不应该忘记这一点，”他在塞尔维亚报纸的一篇文章中写道。 Mr Xi wrapped up his tour in Hungary, a member of the ;EU; and ;NATO; that is also a staunch supporter of China. Mr Xi praised its “independent” foreign policy.

;

;;Israel; carried out ;air strikes on Rafah; in southern ;Gaza; and told 100,000 civilians to leave because it was planning to “operate” there.它控制了费城走廊的部分地区、靠近埃及的一片土地以及与埃及边境的拉法过境点。乔·拜登表示，他不会向以色列提供用于袭击拉法的武器。 Meanwhile, Israel temporarily closed Kerem Shalom, a commercial crossing into Gaza through which most humanitarian aid enters the strip, after four soldiers were killed in a rocket attack by Hamas.

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/09/politics /content/h5ralsupjbomh1om7cbe9gel36pfjjdv Thu, 09 May 2024 13:43:03 GMT 商业
;;;
;;
;;

;;Disney; reported that its Disney+ and Hulu streaming services had made a combined operating profit of $47m in the three months ending March 30th, a huge improvement on the $587m loss in the same quarter last year. The overall loss from streaming, including ;ESPN,; in the recent quarter narrowed to just $18m.为了促进业务，迪士尼在美国宣布推出新的流媒体捆绑包，其中将包括华纳兄弟探索频道的节目。但流媒体部门缺乏盈利能力仍然是投资者不满的一个根源。 After the company dampened expectations for growth in the current quarter, its share price tumbled by nearly 10%.

;

;By contrast, the stock of ;;UBS;; leapt by 10% after it reported a quarterly net profit of $1.8bn, well above market forecasts.这家瑞士银行受益于其财富管理业务和投资银行业务收入的飙升。 It also lowered the estimate of losses it expects to incur from the toxic parts of the business it inherited from Credit Suisse.

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/09/business /content/bqbsgm1br2krr7g058c88ju7ql9fccov Thu, 09 May 2024 13:43:02 GMT KAL的卡通
;;
;;

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/09/kals-cartoon /content/l820cfh60f7jru425v19q6bns1tca8ki Thu, 09 May 2024 13:43:00 GMT This week's covers
;;;
;;
;;

;From the May 11th 2024 edition

;;

;Discover stories from this section and more in the list of contents

;;;Explore the edition;;
;;
;;

;;W;;E HAD TWO; covers this week. In most of our editions, we wrote about the breakdown of the economic order. At first glance, the world economy looks reassuringly resilient, yet we fear that it is flirting with collapse.数量令人担忧的触发因素可能会导致陷入无政府状态，强权即正义，战争再次成为大国的手段。 Even if it never comes to conflict, the degradation of the economy could be fast and brutal.

;

;Our working metaphor for this breakdown in norms had been “entropy”, a measure of randomness that crops up in the study of thermodynamics. An image of a smashed globe was peak randomness, we thought.
; 
;But our science-minded colleagues objected that nobody understands entropy, and suggested that a better term for a seemingly steady state vulnerable to sudden collapse would be “metastable equilibrium”. A former science editor even went so far as to illustrate the mechanics with a sketch.
; 
;Oh dear. ;The Economist; was rapidly heading down a rabbit hole better suited to ;Nature ;or ;Science;.是时候倒雪貂了。

;
; https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2024/05/09/this-weeks-covers /content/9aefiv2hjlpha603pu04lufiq231qga8 Thu, 09 May 2024 13:34:05 GMT KAL的卡通
